original: atha bhūtaśuddheranaṃtaraṃ kramamāha //🔽bhūtaśuddhiṃ vidhāyetthamarghyādi sthāpanaṃ caret /
analyzed: atha bhūtaśuddheḥ anantaram kramam āha  bhūtaśuddhim vidhāya ittham arghya ādi sthāpanam caret
translated: Now, after the purification of the elements, he speaks of the sequence.🔽Having thus performed the purification of the elements, one should perform the installation of the argha and so on.

analyzed: prāṇāyāmam tatas kuryāt ṛṣi ādinyā samācaret
translated: Then one should perform the breath control, and should perform the nyasa with the sages and so on.

analyzed: nyāsaiḥ kara aṃgayoḥ kuryāt ātmānam tāriṇīm smaret
translated: One should perform the nyasa on the hands and body, and should remember oneself as Tara.

original: atha āsāmānyārghya sthāpanamāha //🔽tataścā camanaṃ kṛtvā sāmānyārghyaṃ prakalpayet /
analyzed: atha ā sāmānya arghya sthāpanam āha  tatas ca ā camanam kṛtvā sāmānya arghyam prakalpayet
translated: Now he speaks of the installation of the general argha.🔽Then, having sipped water, one should prepare the general argha.

analyzed: maṇḍalam racayet tatas
translated: One should draw a triangle, circle, and square mandala.

analyzed: sādhāra śaktim saṃpūjya tatra ādhāram viniḥkṣipet
translated: Having worshipped the supporting Shakti, one should place the support there.

analyzed: astreṇa pātram saṃśodhya hṛd maṃtreṇa prapūrayet  p
translated: Having purified the vessel with the weapon mantra, it should be filled with the heart mantra.

analyzed: niḥkṣipet tīrtham āvāhya gaṃdha ādīn praṇavena ca
translated: Having invoked the sacred place, and having placed the water of the sacred place, and having invoked the sacred place, one should place the water of the sacred place.

analyzed: darśayet dhenu mudrām vai sāmānya arghya vidhiḥ mataḥ
translated: One should show the he-cow mudrā. This is considered to be the general procedure of the respectful offering.

analyzed: nyāsam pravartate devī ṣoḍhānyāsa puraḥsaram
translated: The deposition of the goddess proceeds, preceded by the six-fold deposition.

analyzed: atha asyāḥ mahā ṣoḍhām āha
translated: Now, he mentions her great six-fold deposition.

analyzed: tārā ṣoḍhām pravakṣyāmi sarva taṃtreṣu gopitam
translated: I will explain Tārā's six-fold deposition, concealed in all the tantras,

analyzed: sarva vighna upaśamanīm sarva pāpa vināśinīm
translated: Which pacifies all obstacles and destroys all sins,

analyzed: mahā dāridrya śamanīm sarva samprat pradāyinīm
translated: Which pacifies great poverty and grants all desired objects,

original: sarvakāmapradāṃ nityāṃ sarvasāmrājyadāyinīṃ //🔽śiṣyāya bhaktiyuktāya vinītāya mahātmane /
analyzed: sarva kāma pradām nityām sarva sāmrājya dāyinīm  śiṣyāya bhakti yuktāya vinītāya mahātmane
translated: Which always grants all desired objects and bestows the sovereignty of all.🔽To a disciple who is endowed with devotion, who is humble, who is magnanimous,

analyzed: vadānyāya kulīnāya śuddha ācāra ratāya ca
translated: Who is generous, who belongs to a noble family, and who is devoted to pure conduct.

analyzed: evam vidhāya deveśi sādhakāya praveśayet
translated: Having done this, O Goddess of the Lord of gods, one should initiate the aspirant.

analyzed: anyathā siddhi hāniḥ syāt ātma ājñā śaṃbhunā kṛtā
translated: Otherwise, there would be loss of accomplishment, as it has been ordained by Śambhu.

analyzed: tathā ca
translated: And so it is said:

analyzed: nyāsam ṣaṭkam tatas kuryāt tārāyāḥ sarva siddhi dam
translated: One should then perform the six-fold deposition of Tārā, which grants all accomplishments.

analyzed: tatra ādau prathamaḥ nyāsaḥ
translated: There, first, the first deposition is that of Śrīkaṇṭha and others, as mentioned before.

original: mātṛkākṣaramuccārya hrī strī hū pūrvakaṃ vadet /
analyzed: mātṛkā akṣaram uccārya hrī strī hū pūrvakam vadet
translated: Having uttered the letters of the alphabet, one should say Hri, Stri, Hu at the beginning.

analyzed: śrīkaṃṭha ādi sa patnīkam namaḥ oṃtam mātṛkā sthale
translated: In the place of the alphabet, one should assign Shrikantha along with his wife, ending with Namah.

analyzed: vinyaset ca caturthī aṃtam nyāsaḥ yam prathamaḥ smṛtaḥ
translated: This assignment is known as the first.

analyzed: asmin nyāse krīyamāṇe devīm evam vidhām smaret
translated: While performing this assignment, one should remember the Goddess as follows:

analyzed: śava pīṭhe samāsīnām nīla kāntim tri locanām
translated: Seated on a corpse seat, having a blue radiance, three eyes,

analyzed: arddha iṃdu śekharām nānā bhūṣaṇa āḍhyām catur bhujām
translated: with a crescent moon on her head, adorned with various ornaments, and four arms.

analyzed: dvitīyam graha nyāsam kuryāt tām sa manusmaret
translated: One should perform the second assignment of the planets, remembering that Goddess.

original: trivījapūrvakaścāyaṃ grahanyāsaḥ samīritaḥ //🔽svarādikaṃ raviṃ raktaṃ hṛdiyavargapūrvakaṃ /
analyzed: tri vīja pūrvakaḥ ca ayam grahanyāsaḥ samīritaḥ  svara ādikam ravim raktam
translated: This assignment of the planets is said to be preceded by the three seed syllables.🔽The sun, which is red and begins with the vowels, should be assigned to the heart.

analyzed: somam śvetam bhuvonyasyaka varga ādyam ca maṃgalam
translated: The moon, which is white and begins with the ka group, should be assigned to the earth. Mars,

original: raktaṃ netratrayanyasya ca vargādyaṃ ca vakṣyasi /🔽vudhaṃ śyāmaṃ nyaset pītaṃ ṭa vargādyaṃgale guruṃ //
analyzed: raktam netra traya nyasya ca varga ādyam ca vakṣyasi  vudham śyāmam nyaset pītam varga ādi aṃgale gurum
translated: which is red and begins with the ca group, should be assigned to the three eyes. Mercury,🔽which is dark and yellow, should be assigned to the ta group. Jupiter, which is white,

original: ta vargādyaṃ śvetavarṇaṃ ghaṭikāyāṃ tu bhārgavaṃ /🔽nīlavarṇaṃ pa vargādyaṃ nābhideśeśanaiśvaraṃ //
analyzed: ta varga ādyam śveta varṇam ghaṭikāyām tu bhārgavam 🔽varga ādyam nābhi deśa īśa naiśvaram
translated: should be assigned to the pa group. Venus, which is white, should be assigned to the ya group.🔽Saturn, which is blue, should be assigned to the śa group. Rāhu, which is black, should be assigned to the ṣa group. Ketu, which is red, should be assigned to the sa group.

analyzed: varga ādyam dhūmra varṇam dhyātvā rāhu nyaset mukhe
translated: Having meditated on the letter beginning with śa and having the color of smoke, one should install Rāhu on the face.
Having meditated on the letter beginning with la and having the color of smoke, one should install Ketu on the navel.

analyzed: nyāsam tṛtīyam vakṣyāmi vīja tritaya pūrvakam
translated: I will now describe the third nyāsa preceded by the three seed-syllables.

original: samānavarṇānuccārya prāgiṃdrāya namostute //🔽na sisaṃdhyakṣarāṇyuktvācāgneyyāmagnaye namaḥ /🔽dakṣiṇeyamāya namaḥ ka vargādyaṃ lalāṭake //
analyzed: samāna varṇān uccārya prāk iṃdrāya namostute  na si saṃdhi akṣarāṇi uktvā ācā āgneyyām agnaye namaḥ  dakṣiṇā iyamāya namaḥ ka varga ādyam lalāṭake
translated: Having uttered the letters of the same color, one should offer salutations to Indra in the east.🔽Having uttered the letters of the joints, one should offer salutations to Agni in the southeast.🔽One should offer salutations to Yama in the south, having meditated on the letter beginning with ka on the forehead.

original: ca vargādyaṃ ca nairṛtyāṃ nairṛtyāya namo mukhe /
analyzed: ca varga ādyam ca nairṛtyām nairṛtyāya namaḥ mukhe
translated: One should offer salutations to Nairṛti in the southwest, having meditated on the letter beginning with ca on the face.

analyzed: ṭa varga ādi aṃgale paścāt varuṇāya namaḥ tu iti  p
translated: One should offer salutations to Varuṇa in the west, having meditated on the letter beginning with ṭa on the back.

original: nyaseddhṛdi ta vargādyaṃ vāyavyāṃ vāyave namaḥ /
analyzed: nyaset hṛdi ta varga ādyam vāyavyām vāyave namaḥ
translated: One should offer salutations to Vāyu in the northwest, having meditated on the letter beginning with ta on the heart.

original: pa vargādyaṃ kuverāya namoṃtaṃ dakṣiṇe kare //🔽vāmahaste ya vargādīśāṇa rudrāya hṛdbhavet /
analyzed: varga ādyam kuverāya namaḥ oṃ tam dakṣiṇe kare  vāma haste rudrāya hṛd bhavet
translated: One should offer salutations to Kubera in the right hand, having meditated on the letter beginning with pa.🔽One should offer salutations to Īśāna in the left hand, having meditated on the letter beginning with ya on the heart.

analyzed: śavarga ādi ūrddha kāmāya namaḥ nābhau tu vinyaset
translated: One should offer salutations to Ūrdhvakāma, having meditated on the letter beginning with śa on the navel.

analyzed: rakṣa adya pṛthivyai hṛdi ādayoḥ iti vinyaset
translated: One should offer salutations to Pṛthivī, having meditated on the letter beginning with ha on the heart.

analyzed: kathyate adhunā
translated: Now the fourth nyāsa is being described, which is named after Śiva and Śakti.

original: hrī strī hū pūrvakaḥ kārya iṃdriyādya haraḥ paraṃ /🔽brahmāṇaṃ ḍākinīyuktaṃ vādisyaṃ tārṇapūrvakaṃ //
analyzed: hrī strī hū pūrvakaḥ kāryaḥ iṃdriya ādya haraḥ param  brahmāṇam ḍākinī yuktam vādisyam tārṇa pūrvakam
translated: The supreme Hara of the senses etc. should be assigned, preceded by Hri, Stri, Hu.

original: mūlādhāra pravinyasyeccaturdala samanvitaṃ /🔽śrīviṣṇuṃśākinī yuktaṃ vādilāṃ tārṇapūrvakaṃ //
analyzed: pravinyasyet catur dala samanvitam
translated: Brahma, united with Dhakini, with the letters beginning with Va, should be assigned to the four-petaled lotus at the root of the genital organ.

original: svādhiṣṭānābhidhe vakre liṃgasthe ṣaṭdale nyaset /🔽rudraṃ tu lākinī yuktaṃ ḍādiphāṃtārṇapūrvakaṃ //
analyzed: svādhiṣṭāna abhidhe vakre liṃga sthe ṣaṭdale nyaset  rudram tu lākinī yuktam ḍa ādi phāṃta arṇa pūrvakam
translated: Sri Vishnu, united with Shakini, with the letters beginning with Va, should be assigned to the lotus of six petals at the genital organ, known as Svādhiṣṭhāna.

original: cakre daśadalaṃ nyasyennābhisthe maṇipūrake /🔽īśvaraṃkādivātārṇa pūrvakaṃ kākinīyutaṃ //
analyzed: īśvara ka ādi vāta arṇa pūrvakam kākinī yutam
translated: Rudra, united with Lākinī, with the letters beginning with Ḍa and ending with Pha, should be assigned to the lotus of ten petals at the navel, known as Maṇipūra.

original: vinyased dvādaśadale hṛdayasthetvanāhate /🔽sadāśivaṃ śākinīṃ ca ṣoḍaśasvarapūrvakaṃ //
analyzed: vinyaset dvādaśa dale hṛdaya stha iti anāhate  sadāśivam śākinīm ca ṣoḍaśa svara pūrvakam
translated: Īśvara, united with Kākinī, with the letters beginning with Ka and ending with Va, should be assigned to the lotus of twelve petals at the heart, known as Anahata.

original: kaṃṭhasthe ṣoḍaśadale viśuddhākhye pravinyaset /🔽ājñācakre paraśivaṃ hākinī saṃyutaṃ nyaset //
analyzed: kaṃṭha sthe ṣoḍaśa dale viśuddha ākhye pravinyaset  ājñācakre para śivam hākinī saṃyutam nyaset
translated: Sadāśiva, united with Śākinī, with the letters beginning with Ṣa and ending with Ṣa, should be assigned to the lotus of sixteen petals at the throat, known as Viśuddha.

analyzed: hakṣa arṇam bhrū madhye saṃsthitā iti manoharam
translated: One should assign Paraśiva, united with Hākinī, with the letters Ha and Kṣa, in the middle of the eyebrows, which is charming.

analyzed: vakṣyastha paṃcama nyāsam samasta ariṣṭa nāśanam
translated: Now I will tell the fifth Nyāsa, which destroys all calamities.

original: a ā kavarga hrī strī hū tārāyai nama uccaret /
analyzed: a ā kavarga hrī strī hū tārāyai namaḥ uccaret
translated: One should utter A Ā Ka, the group of letters beginning with Ka, Hri, Stri, Hu, to Tārā, salutations.

original: vinyased brahmaraṃdhretha i ī cāpi ca vargakaṃ //🔽hrī strī hū nama ugrāyai lalāṭe cāpi vinyaset /
analyzed: vinyaset ca api ca vargakam  hrī strī hū namaḥ ugrāyai lalāṭe ca api vinyaset
translated: Then one should place the letters I and E, and the group of letters beginning with Ca,🔽and the syllable Hri, Sree, Hu, and Namah, to Ugra, on the forehead.

original: u ū ca varga strī hrī hū mahogrāyai namo vadet //
analyzed: ca varga strī hrī hū mahā ugrāyai namaḥ vadet
translated: One should place the letters U and U, the group of letters beginning with Ta, Hri, Sree, Hu, and Namah, to Mahograya,

original: vinnyasecca bhruvormadhye kaṇṭha ṛ ṝ ṭa vargakaṃ /🔽hrī strī hū cāpi vajrāyai namoṃtaṃ sa kaleṣvapi //
analyzed: vid nyaset ca bhruvoḥ madhye kaṇṭhe ṛ ṝ ṭa vargakam  hrī strī hū ca api vajrāyai namaḥ oṃ tam sa kaleṣu api
translated: in the middle of the eyebrows, and the group of letters beginning with Ta,🔽Hri, Sree, Hu, and Namah, to Vajraya, in the throat, and in the joints.

original: ḷ ḹ ta varga hrī strī hū namaḥ kālyai hṛdinyaset /
analyzed: ḷ ḷ ta varga hrī strī hū namaḥ kālyai hṛdi nyaset
translated: One should place the letters La and La, the group of letters beginning with Ta, Hri, Sree, Hu, Namah, to Kalya, in the heart.

original: e ai pa varga hrī strī hū sarasvatyai ca nābhigāṃ //🔽oṃ auṃ śa varga hrī strī hū vāmuścarya ca liṃgake /
analyzed: e ai pa varga hrī strī hū sarasvatyai ca nābhigām  om aum śa varga hrī strī hū ca liṃgake
translated: One should place the letters E and Ai, the group of letters beginning with Pa, Hri, Sree, Hu, to Sarasvati, in the navel.🔽One should place the letters Om and Au, the group of letters beginning with Sha, Hri, Sree, Hu, to Vama, in the genital organ.

original: a aḥ rakṣau ca hrī strī hū cāmuṇḍāyai namonyaset //🔽mūlādhārenyasetyaścā sveṣṭenyāsaṃ samācaret /
analyzed: a aḥ rakṣau ca hrī strī hū cāmuṇḍāyai namaḥ nyaset  sva iṣṭenyāsam samācaret
translated: One should place the letters A and Ah, the group of letters beginning with Ra, Hri, Sree, Hu, Namah, to Chamunda, in the anus.🔽One should perform the nyasa in the root chakra, and then perform the nyasa as desired.

original: ādhāre kāmarūpākṣaṃ vīja hrasvā na pūrvakaṃ //🔽hṛdi jālaṃdharaṃ pīṭhaṃ dīrghapūrvaṃ tu vinyaset /
analyzed: ādhāre kāmarūpa akṣam hrasvā na pūrvakam  hṛdi jālaṃdharam pīṭham dīrgha pūrvam tu vinyaset
translated: In the base, one should place the seed syllable of Kamarupa, with short vowels first.🔽In the heart, one should place the Jalंधara seat, with long vowels first.

original: lalāṭe pūrṇagiryākhyaṃ ka vargādyaṃ nyaset sudhīḥ //
analyzed: lalāṭe pūrṇagiri ākhyam ka varga ādyam nyaset sudhīḥ
translated: The wise one should place the seat called Pūrṇagiri, with the group of letters beginning with Ka, on the forehead.

analyzed: uḍḍīyānam ca varga ādyam keśa saṃdhyaiḥ pravinyaset
translated: One should place the seat called Uḍḍiyāna, with the group of letters beginning with Ca, on the hair parting.

analyzed: bhuvoḥ vārāṇasīm pīṭham varga ādyam samāhitam  p
translated: The seat of Varanasi on the earth is placed first in the Ta group.🔽The seat of Devīkoṭa is placed in the Tha group.

original: ta varga pūrvakānyasyedavaṃti nayanadvaye /🔽pa varga pūrvakaṃ māyāpūripīṭhaṃ mukhanyaset //
analyzed: nayana dvaye
translated: The seat of Pūrṇagiri is placed in the Da group.🔽The seat of Kāmarūpa is placed in the Dha group.🔽The seat of Oḍiyāna is placed in the Na group.🔽The seat of Godāvarī is placed in the Pha group.🔽The seat of Rāmeśvara is placed in the Bha group.🔽The seat of Hāṭakeśvara is placed in the Ya group.🔽The seat of Māyāpuri is placed in the La group.

original: kaṃṭhe tu mathurāpīṭhaṃ ya vargādyaṃ pravinyaset /
analyzed: kaṃṭhe tu mathurā pīṭham varga ādyam pravinyaset
translated: The seat of Mathurā is placed in the Va group.

analyzed: nābhāva yodhyā pīṭham tu śa varga ādyam pravinyaset
translated: The seat of Ayodhyā is placed in the Śa group.

analyzed: kaṭau kāṃcī purī pīṭham daśamam tu pravinyaset
translated: The tenth seat of Kāñcīpurī is placed in the Sa group.

analyzed: ṣoḍhānyāsaḥ tu tārāyāḥ proktaḥ abhīṣṭa pradāyakaḥ
translated: The six-fold nyāsa of Tārā, which bestows the desired objects, has been described.

analyzed: atha maṃtra ṣoḍhāḥ
translated: Now, the six-fold mantras.

analyzed: maṃtreṇa aṃtaritām kṛtvā ṣaṣ vārām mātṛkām nyaset
translated: Having interspersed with the mantra, one should perform the nyāsa of the mātṛkā six times.

analyzed: kramāt varārohe tārā ṣoḍhā prakīrtitāḥ
translated: O beautiful lady, the six-fold Tārā is proclaimed in the reverse order.

analyzed: kṛte asmin nyāsa parye tu sarva pāpam vinaśyati
translated: When this nyāsa is performed, all sins are destroyed.

original: yoginīnāṃ bhavet pūjyaḥ sa devo na tu mānuṣaḥ //
analyzed: yoginīnām bhavet pūjyaḥ sa devaḥ na tu mānuṣaḥ
translated: He becomes venerable to the yoginīs, that god, not a human.

original: yaṃ namaṃti maheśāni ṣoḍhāḥ pūtita vigrahāḥ /
analyzed: yam namaṃti maheśāni ṣoḍhāḥ vigrahāḥ
translated: O Maheśānī, those whose bodies are purified by the six-fold salutations to him,

original: alpāyuḥ sa bhavet sadyo devatā kaṃpate bhayāt //
analyzed: alpa āyuḥ sa bhavet sadyas devatā kaṃpate bhayāt
translated: he would have a short life, and the deity trembles with fear.

original: na tasya pūrvyolokesmin pitṛmātṛ tu yojanaḥ //
analyzed: na tasya tu yojanaḥ
translated: In this world, he has no connection with his ancestors or mother.

analyzed: atha guhya ṣoḍhām āha
translated: Now he speaks of the secret Shodhas.

analyzed: na prakāśyam idam kvāpi maṃtriṇaḥ kāya rakṣaṇe
translated: This should not be revealed anywhere for the protection of the body of the Mantra practitioner.

analyzed: praṇavam mātṛkā varṇam mātṛkā sthale
translated: The Praṇava and the Mātṛkā letters are purified in the Mātṛkā place.

original: tenaiva pūṭitaṃ varṇaṃ nyaset tatraiva pārvati /
analyzed: tena eva pūṭitam varṇam nyaset tatra eva pārvati
translated: With that very purified letter, one should deposit it there itself, O Pārvatī.

analyzed: māyāvījam tathā devī vinyastavyam prayatnataḥ
translated: The Māyā seed should be deposited there, O Goddess, with effort.

analyzed: vadhūvījam tathā devī vinyaset tu samāhitam
translated: The Vādhū seed should be deposited there, O Goddess, with concentration.

analyzed: kūrcavījam tathā anyasanīyam
translated: The Kūrca seed should be deposited there, O Goddess, with all the rest.

original: astreṃ caiva mathānyastvā sa karaṃ tadanaṃtaraṃ /
analyzed: ca eva sa karam tad anaṃtaram
translated: And the weapon should be deposited after that, and then the hand.

original: guhya ṣoḍhāhyayaṃ devī na prakāśyā kadācana //
analyzed: ṣoḍhā hi ayam devī na prakāśyā kadācana
translated: This is the secret Shodhas, O Goddess, which should never be revealed.

original: avaśyaṃ pratyahaṃ kāryaṃ na pūjā na japastathā //
analyzed: avaśyam pratyaham kāryam na pūjā na japaḥ tathā
translated: It must be done every day, not the worship or the Japa.

analyzed: atha asyāḥ sāmānya ṣoḍhā tu śyāmā prakaraṇe pi uktā
translated: Now, the general Shodhas of this (Mantra) are mentioned in the Śyāmā Prakaraṇa (chapter).
In the method of the Tārā Vidyā, the fourfold Shodhas should be performed, O Goddess.

analyzed: atha nakṣatrakānyāsaḥ
translated: Now, the Nyāsa of the Nakshatras (lunar mansions).

analyzed: akāra ādi kramatas nyasya rohiṇī ādi krameṇa tu
translated: The A, Ā, etc. should be deposited in order, and the Rohiṇī, etc. in order.

original: vyutkrameṇa ca catvāriśeṣaṃ śeṣaṃ na yojayet //
analyzed: vyutkrameṇa ca catvāri śeṣam śeṣam na yojayet
translated: And in the reverse order, the remaining forty should not be connected.

analyzed: rohiṇī ādi mahā nyāsam kṛtvā nara vara tsudhīḥ
translated: Having performed the great Nyāsa beginning with Rohiṇī, the best man of good intellect,

analyzed: rohiṇī suta vat pṛthvyām ā aśocyaḥ bhavati dhruvam
translated: One who has a son like Rohini on earth is certainly not to be grieved over.

analyzed: a kṛtvā tārakā nyāsam tāriṇīm prayajet yadi
translated: If one worships Tara without performing the Nyasa of the stars,

analyzed: śatarakṣa prajaptaḥ api na maṃtraḥ siddhi dāyakaḥ
translated: Even if the mantra is repeated a hundred times, it does not bestow success.

analyzed: maṃtra siddhim na viṃdati

analyzed: tasmāt rahasya paramam sarva siddhi labhaṃti te
translated: Therefore, those who obtain all accomplishments obtain this supreme secret.

analyzed: gopyāt gopyataram gopyam guhyāt guhyatara matam

translated: Thus ends the Matangi Kavacha in the Shri Guhyakali Tantra.

analyzed: tāra māyādharāḥ vīja pūrvaḥ paṃcākṣaraḥ manuḥ
translated: The five-syllabled mantra beginning with the seed syllables of Tara, Maya, and Dhara,

analyzed: aṣṭa varṇaḥ bhavet asya vāmadevī muniḥ mataḥ  p
translated: Its eight syllables, the sage is considered to be Vamadeva.

translated: With four hands, holding a red lotus with the hands,

analyzed: vāma aṃka saṃsthitām

analyzed: rakta padma samāsīnam rakta sraj gaṃdha lepanam

translated: The sage is Shakti, the meter is Gayatri, and the deity is Manu.

analyzed: savya aṃśe pārśva yugale nābhi deśe ca deśikaḥ
translated: On the right side, on the two ribs, and on the navel region.
On the forehead, on the sides, on the belly, and on the sides of the heart.

translated: In Puṣkala, holding a sword with a sparkling jewel,

translated: with a form resembling vermilion, intoxicated with excessive passion,🔽holding a red lotus in one hand, touching the banner with another hand,

analyzed: kusumā paścāt anaṃga kusumā āturā
translated: Ananga, Kusumā, and Kusumāturā,

analyzed: bhuvanapālā gagaṇaiḥ vegā ca eva tatas param
translated: Bhūvanapālā, Gagana, and Vegā after that,

translated: Śakti, Rekhe, Gaṇārekhe, and Rekhe, the eight white ones,

analyzed: p
translated: holding a noose, goad, boon, and protection, with a reddish body.

analyzed: tatas ṣoḍaśa patreṣu karālī vikarālī umā
translated: Then, on the sixteen petals, Karālī, Vikarālī, Umā,

translated: One should worship the sixteen Shaktis - Sraddha, Medha, Mati, Kanti, and others,🔽The dark-complexioned mothers holding swords and shields.

analyzed: padmāt vahis samabhyarcyāḥ śaktayaḥ paricārikāḥ

analyzed: syāt  caṣakam tālavṛṃtam ca tāṃbūlam chatram ujvalām

translated: Chamaras, ankusha, and flowers with their lotus hands,

analyzed: iḍe sakala saṃpatyai jagat kāraṇam aṃvikām

translated: The primordial mother of all, the one who is honored as the form of Vishnu and Shiva,
